commit_message:
Changes path used for trove-guestagent.conf

Reasons:
- Guest Agent uses trove-guestagent.conf.sample directly,
  which is not correct way to do it.
- Probably this was a workaround, because /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building up due to another Bug: 1265184 in trove.

Changes:
- Corrected the path of config file to be used as
  /etc/trove-guestagent.conf.

Dependency:
- This change would only pass the gate-tests
  when Bug: 1265184 gets resolved.

Change-Id: I25ff15fb16ee80f33e447ff83ffa760919646446
Closes-Bug: #1176102

added_lines: ExecStart=/home/GUEST_USERNAME/trove/bin/trove-guestagent --config-file=/etc/guest_info --config-file=/etc/trove-guestagent.conf

commit_message:
Fix controller howto for Debian

Many parts of the install-guide for the nova controler node
and compute node must be removed in Debian, since that's
handled by Debconf. It is more confusing than anything else.
So this patch hides some steps from the Debian install-guide.

Change-Id: I374cf3fb3103b49c60f28648e1f7a16dfe274387
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/63/65263/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding support for extra_specs (key:value pairs)

After changing compute_capabilities_filter from RPC to DB,
instance_type_extra_specs doesn't work at all.
This bug is fixed by adding extra_specs column into compute_nodes
and comparing each key:value pair between flavor_extra_specs
in nova.conf and flavor-key.

Change-Id: I558c42e1be1fb58c9c23fdfb056de472be84c26b
Closes-Bug: #1245541
Co-authored-by: David Kang <dkang@isi.edu>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/62088/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.extra_specs = None if compute.get('extra_specs'): self.extra_specs = jsonutils.loads(compute.get('extra_specs')) for key, val in self.extra_specs.iteritems(): setattr(self, key, val)

commit_message:
Added tenant_id property to OS::Neutron::Router

Now a router could be created passing the ID of the tenant which will
own the router. Only administrative users can set the tenant
identifier.

Some test were added to ensure that tenant_id is handled properly, and
some of the existing test were reorganized in different classes.

Change-Id: If47f89577673a98c0b6332db3a16a829f667c574
Closes-Bug: #1246629

spawn_n returns a greenlet object from which it is not possible to
retrieve either a return value or whether it raised any exceptions.
spawn returns a GreenThread object which you can use to get the
results of the call. In order to let the caller know the failure of
processing router(s), we should use spawn insead of spawn_n.

Added a new exception named ProcessRoutersError that is raised if
the spawned function fails.
Added related unit tests.

Change-Id: I15b732c97d52c74c15b08961bf01f6dca4e19a59
Closes-Bug: #1254984
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
'}]
commit_message:
l3_agent: use spawn instead of spawn_n in _process_routers

spawn_n returns a greenlet object from which it is not possible to
retrieve either a return value or whether it raised any exceptions.
spawn returns a GreenThread object which you can use to get the
results of the call. In order to let the caller know the failure of
processing router(s), we should use spawn insead of spawn_n.

Added a new exception named ProcessRoutersError that is raised if
the spawned function fails.
Added related unit tests.

Change-Id: I15b732c97d52c74c15b08961bf01f6dca4e19a59
Closes-Bug: #1254984
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/58668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ProcessRoutersError(NeutronException): message = _("Failed to process the router(s): %(router_ids)s")

commit_message:
Set SCSI as default disk bus on Power KVM

Overwrites the default KVM bus for disk and cdrom, IDE and virtio,
respectively. This check (after the get_disk_bus_for_device_type
call) keeps the current code flow for other archs and virt types.

Change-Id: I5098001180b3a87b4b5dfc84f9671d976c6248c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/65276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if "POWER" in caps.host.cpu.model: disk_bus = "scsi" cdrom_bus = "scsi"

commit_message:
Change l3-agent to periodically check children are running

The l3-agent will now store info on the metadata-proxy process
it spawns, and use it to check if it's still running every time
_sync_routers_task() is called.  If it is not alive it will be
restarted.

A new flag, called 'check_child_processes', controls this behaviour.
Default value is False.

Closes-Bug: #1257775

Change-Id: Icc304db31b4a5cca292f52d82d3eb80383a54918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/59997/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._metadata_proxy_process = None cfg.BoolOpt('check_child_processes', default=False, help=_("Periodically check that any child processes we " "spawned are running.")), self._destroy_metadata_proxy(self.router_info[router_id]) self._spawn_metadata_proxy(ri) self._destroy_metadata_proxy(ri) def _spawn_metadata_proxy(self, router_info): '--router_id=%s' % router_info.router_id, router_info.router_id)) pm = router_info._metadata_proxy_process if not pm: pm = external_process.ProcessManager( self.conf, router_info.router_id, self.root_helper, router_info.ns_name()) router_info._metadata_proxy_process = pm def _destroy_metadata_proxy(self, router_info): router_info._metadata_proxy_process.disable() def _check_metadata_proxy(self, router_info): if not router_info._metadata_proxy_process.active: LOG.warning(_("Metadata proxy not running, router %s, restarting"), router_info.router_id) self._spawn_metadata_proxy(router_info) if self.conf.check_child_processes: self._check_child_processes() def _check_processes(self, ri): if ri._metadata_proxy_process: self._check_metadata_proxy(ri) def _check_child_processes(self): LOG.debug(_("Starting _check_child_processes")) pool = eventlet.GreenPool() router_infos = self.router_info.values() for ri in router_infos: pool.spawn_n(self._check_processes, ri) pool.waitall()
deleted_lines: self._destroy_metadata_proxy(router_id, ns) self._spawn_metadata_proxy(ri.router_id, ri.ns_name()) self._destroy_metadata_proxy(ri.router_id, ri.ns_name()) def _spawn_metadata_proxy(self, router_id, ns_name): '--router_id=%s' % router_id, router_id)) pm = external_process.ProcessManager( self.conf, router_id, self.root_helper, ns_name) def _destroy_metadata_proxy(self, router_id, ns_name): pm = external_process.ProcessManager( self.conf, router_id, self.root_helper, ns_name) pm.disable()

subject: Fixes delete of protected rbd images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-07 07:34:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/4325dec82a8b237c4bc78c6f866ff4753481b6fb', 'message': 'Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image
is deleted where the underlying rbd image is protected due
to an existing clone in cinder i.e. a volume that has been
created (cloned) from the image currently exists. The solution
here is to flag the image for async delete i.e. we check
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able
to be deleted and cleanup if possible.

Fixes: bug 1185851
Change-Id: I3e0a08d392b90be6a544eeb841b7a1205b7c8cca
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-11-14 13:59:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/e2bfd6a3733f35f57b7b8a7264b060e2aa70393a', 'message': 'Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image
is deleted where the underlying rbd image is protected due
to an existing clone in cinder i.e. a volume that has been
created (cloned) from the image currently exists. The solution
here is to flag the image for async delete i.e. we check
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able
to be deleted and cleanup if possible.

Fixes: bug 1185851
Change-Id: I3e0a08d392b90be6a544eeb841b7a1205b7c8cca
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-11-29 11:53:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/bf2a2391ba869f33cf2a83be5ca8b9de86704f59', 'message': 'Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image
is deleted when the underlying rbd image has a protected
snapshot because a clone exists in cinder i.e. a volume
that has been created (cloned) from the image currently
exists. The solution here is to flag the rbd image for
async delete, allow the glance delete to succeed and
check on some fututr event (currently on subsequent
deletes) whether the image is able to be deleted and
attempt a cleanup..

Closes-bug: bug 1185851
Change-Id: I3e0a08d392b90be6a544eeb841b7a1205b7c8cca
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-16 17:33:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/6b7dd63a4de70c3527ec7ac4b8e32c1200acc1bf', 'message': 'Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image is
deleted when the underlying rbd image has a protected snapshot
because a clone exists in cinder i.e. a volume that has been
created (cloned) from the image currently exists. The solution
here is to flag the rbd image for async delete, allow the
glance delete to succeed and check on some future event
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able to
be deleted and attempt a cleanup.

because a clone exists in cinder i.e. a volume that has been

glance delete to succeed and check on some future event
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able to

commit_message:
Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image is
deleted when the underlying rbd image has a protected snapshot
because a clone exists in cinder i.e. a volume that has been
created (cloned) from the image currently exists. The solution
here is to flag the rbd image for async delete, allow the
glance delete to succeed and check on some future event
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able to
be deleted and attempt a cleanup.

Closes-bug: bug 1185851
Change-Id: I3e0a08d392b90be6a544eeb841b7a1205b7c8cca

added_lines: import refrom glance.openstack.common import strutilsclass ImageDeleteFlag(object): def __init__(self, ioctx, image_name, snap_name): self._ioctx = ioctx self.rados = rados self.image_name = image_name self.snap_name = snap_name @staticmethod def pattern(): return r"^glance\.(.+)\.(.+)\.deleted$" @property def name(self): return strutils.safe_encode("glance.%s.%s.deleted" % (self.image_name, self.snap_name)) @classmethod def get_all(cls, ioctx): images = [] objs = ioctx.list_objects() for obj in objs: result = re.search(cls.pattern(), obj.key) if result: images.append([result.group(0), result.group(1), result.group(2)]) return images def _exists(self, obj): try: obj.read() obj.seek(0) except self.rados.ObjectNotFound: return False else: return True def set(self): LOG.debug(_("setting flag object '%s'") % (self.name)) meta_obj = self.rados.Object(self._ioctx, self.name) if self._exists(meta_obj): LOG.debug(_("delete flag '%s' already exists - skipping set") % (self.name)) return meta_obj.write("\0") def remove(self): LOG.debug(_("removing flag object '%s'") % (self.name)) meta_obj = self.rados.Object(self._ioctx, self.name) meta_obj.remove() def _set_rbd_flag_for_delete(self, image, snap): with rados.Rados(conffile=self.conf_file, rados_id=self.user) as conn: with conn.open_ioctx(self.pool) as ioctx: ImageDeleteFlag(ioctx, image, snap).set() def _cleanup_stale_images(self): with rados.Rados(conffile=self.conf_file, rados_id=self.user) as conn: with conn.open_ioctx(self.pool) as ioctx: images = ImageDeleteFlag.get_all(ioctx) for image_info in images: image = image_info[1] snap = image_info[2] try: self._delete_image(image, snap) except rbd.ImageBusy: msg = (_("pending delete image '%(image)s@%(snap)s' " "still busy - skipping delete") % {'image': image, 'snap': snap}) LOG.debug(msg) else: ImageDeleteFlag(ioctx, image, snap).remove() NOTE(dosaboy): when deleting images we need to account for the fact that the image may be 'protected' because clones exist, probably in cinder. See LP1185851. msg = _("snapshot %(image)s@%(snap)s could " "not be unprotected because it is " "in use - flagging for async delete") LOG.debug(msg % self._set_rbd_flag_for_delete(image_name, snapshot_name) # Return here since we cannot continue. return else: image.remove_snap(snapshot_name) self._cleanup_stale_images()

commit_message:
Except 404 for "detail" api call of deleted flavor

* Nova (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59860/) will not return details
  of deleted flavor for flavor detail api because deleted/non-deleted
  flavorid are not unique in DB, and duplicate flavor of same flavorid
  can be returned by flavor details api
* Fix the related tempest test to expect 404 for detail flavor api call
* Skip the test till Nova review gets in
  (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59860/)

Change-Id: I1695fb827d65feea119a76aac4c393b60b866a4e
Closes-Bug: #1153926

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/11/63411/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack Identity API v3 Apache Profile for Federation ======================================================= This document specifies a profile for the federated authentication plugin described in "Add Support for Federated Authentication (Pt 3)" The federated authentication plugin delegates all the protocol dependent functionality to protocol specific modules. Each federation protocol needs a profile to describe the required request and response messages. Note that this is independent of the actual implementation. This document describes the profile for a front end Apache2 server which is acting as the service provider to the external IdPs. The IdPs are not aware of the Keystone backend. The protocol name used by this module is "apache2". ###### The `apache2` authentication profile 1. The issuing of an authentication request message by Keystone is not needed. We assume that Apache is able to create its own IDP request messages. 2. The protocol_data provided during the validation phase must contain a JSON structure containing the attributes asserted by each IDP as well as the user's ID and the validity time of the assertion(s). Note. This structure caters for attribute aggregation from a set of IdPs. Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "validate", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "apache2", "protocol_data": [ { "uid": "123456789", "user_identity": [ { "attributes": [ "email": "fred@gmail.com" "organisation": "University of Kent" "uid": "123456787899" ], "idp_name": "kent.ac.uk" }, { "attributes": [ "membership": "gold" ], "idp_name": "ba.com" } ], "validity_time": "20130123T00:00:00Z" } ] } } } } The response for the apache2 profile validation is the same as the standard response described in the Add Support for Federated Authentication (Pt 3) document.

commit_message:
The federation protocol profile for a remote OpenID Connect IdP (Federation pt3 C)

Change-Id: I288838b7f42ef353492f2dece1d61400d0a33c5a
Co-Authored-By: Kristy Siu <kwss@kent.ac.uk>
Co-Authored-By: David Chadwick <d.w.chadwick@kent.ac.uk>
Co-Authored-By: Ioram Schechtman Sette <iss@cin.ufpe.br>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/38/62638/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack Identity API v3 Keystone Profile for Federation ===================================================== The federated authentication plugin delegates all the protocol dependent functionality to protocol specific modules. Each federation protocol needs a profile to describe the required request and response messages. Note that this is independent of the actual implementation. This document describes the profile for a remote OpenID Connect identity provider. The protocol name used by this module is "oidc". The "client_profile" can assume the values "basic" for the OAuth code flow, and "implicit" for the OAuth implicit flow. The protocol name used by this module is "oidc". ###### The `oidc` authentication profile 1. The following protocol specific request parameters are required for the OpenID Connect profile to handle the issuing of an authentication request. The request message should conform to the structure laid out in the federation extension document, viz: Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "request", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "oidc", "protocol_data": [ {"client_profile": "basic" | "implicit"} ] } } } } The response for the OpenID Connect profile must contain the endpoint and request data of the remote OpenID Connect IdP within the protocol_data field. The following example is the basic client profile Response: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "oidc", "protocol_data": [ { "endpoint": "http://openid-provider.com/authorize", "request": "?scope=openid+profile+email+address+phone&state=ABCD1234&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8080%2F&response_type=code&client_id=654321" } ] } } } } The following example is the implicit client profile Response: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "oidc", "protocol_data": [ { "endpoint": "http://openid-provider.com/authorize", "request": "?nonce=xss3ywSS0CpX&state=y5MADmtJt6u1&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8080%2F&response_type=id_token+token&client_id=2b9ab798-d04e-4131-8764-b63e5a15b68b&scope=openid+profile+email+address+phone" } ] } } } } 2. The following protocol specific request parameters are required for the OpenID Connect profile to handle the response of the authentication request in the validate phase. For basic client profile: Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "validate", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "oidc", "protocol_data": [ { "state": "ABCD1234", "code" : "EFGH4321" } ] } } } } For implicit client profile: Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "negotiation", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "oidc", "protocol_data": [ { "state": "ABCD1234", "access_token": "0011223344556677", "token_type": "Bearer", "id_token": "8899AABBCCDDEEFF", "expires_in": "3599", "authuser": "iss", "hd": "cin.ufpe.br", "session_state": "AA00BB11", "prompt": "none" } ] } } } } The response for the OpenID Connect profile validation is the same as the standard response described in Add Support for Federated Authentication (Pt 3) document.

commit_message:
The federation protocol profile for a remote SAML IdP (Federation pt3 B)

This profile describes how the SAML protocol should be supported.

Co-Authored-By: Kristy Siu <kwss@kent.ac.uk>
Co-Authored-By: David Chadwick <d.w.chadwick@kent.ac.uk>

Change-Id: Ib002f099d43150bf266c283d1803ccbe2370216d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/04/62604/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack Identity API v3 SAML Profile for Federation ===================================================== This document specifies a profile for the federated authentication plugin described in "Add Support for Federated Authentication (Pt 3)" The federated authentication plugin delegates all the protocol dependent functionality to protocol specific modules. Each federation protocol needs a profile to describe the required request and response messages. Note that this is independent of the actual implementation. This document describes the profile for a remote SAML identity provider. The protocol name used by this module is either "saml.websso" or "saml.ecp" depending upon the client's requirements. ###### The `saml` authentication profile 1. No protocol specific request parameters are required for the SAML profile to handle the issuing of an authentication request. The request message should conform to the structure laid out in the federated authentication plugin document, viz: Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "request", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "saml.websso | saml.ecp", "protocol_data": [] } } } } The response for the SAML profile must contain the endpoint of the remote SAML identity provider, and the SAMLRequest for authentication (which should be a Base 64 encoded SAML AuthnRequest conforming to either the Web browser SSO or ECP profile as requested by the client) within the protocol_data field. Response: { "error": { "message": "Additional authentication steps required.", "code": 401, "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "saml.websso | saml.ecp", "protocol_data": [ { "endpoint": "https://samlidp.com/SSOLogin.php", "SAMLRequest": "GR..CD7=..." } ] } }, "title": "Unauthorized" } } 2. The SAML profile expects that the protocol_data provided during the validation phase contains a Base 64 encoded SAML assertion signed using the private key of the SAML IdP used to authenticate. The corresponding public key should be provided in the stored identity provider data. Request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "federated" ], "federated": { "phase": "validate", "provider_id": "123456", "protocol": "saml.websso | saml.ecp | saml", "protocol_data": [ { "data": "HJ..RF8=" } ] } } } } The response for the http profile validation is the same as the standard response described in the Add Support for Federated Authentication (Pt 3) document.

commit_message:
Add the ability to define API extensions using pecan

This is a potential approach I've considered for gradually moving the V3 API
to pecan.  Other newer projects tend to define their API declaratively with
pecan's object dispatch-style routing, but given Nova's large number of
extensions (and the fact that API routing is a composition of installed
packages with stevedore entrypoints), the more traditional approach would
probably involve a fundamental change in how the API is structured/composed.
Instead, this approach entails:

1.  Creating a pecan WSGI app that auto-discovers extensions written with pecan
2.  Overrides the /v3/ WSGI app's __call__ to attempt to route to the previous
    WSGI implementation *first*, falling back to the pecan implementation if no
    matching route is found
3.  Gradually rewriting extensions using pecan.  This patchset provides an
    implementation of the `version` endpoint.  When all extensions make
    use of pecan, the previous WSGI routing code is removed

Includes support for using our existing XML and ATOM serialization functions.

Implements: blueprint v3-api-pecan
Change-Id: I6f2b62228c4dcae704f5768bca2fbdac5afc54ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/61303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class PecanV3APIExtensionBase(V3APIExtensionBase): """Base class for Pecan-based V3 API extensions. V3 API extensions can inherit from this class and implement Pecan-style object dispatch routing. """ @abc.abstractproperty def alias(self): """URL path of this extension""" pass def get_controller_extensions(self): return [] def get_resources(self): return [ResourceExtension(self.alias, self)]

commit_message:
Add group support to KDS

Allow creating groups, requesting tickets for group keys and for
retrieving group keys.

SecImpact
blueprint: key-distribution-server
Change-Id: I92aefd2ac1d9c2fa65efa13384a9390cc107b048

commit_message:
Handle dict in object serialization

object doesn't handle dict serialization. For instance,
serializing {'foo': 123, 'obj': MyObj()} would cause an error.

The case will happen in filter_properties which is going to contain
instance type objects.
This patch is to add that support.

As remotable_classmethod() does, because deserialize_entity()
will convert primitives of Nova objects in 'updates' in
remotable() to real Nova objects, where 'updates' is also a
dict. We don't need to convert it again if a Nova object is
one of the fields.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I754bd33adc48cbd2279e0b914e9a3d399dca3c8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/63995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # test dict obj = {'foo': MyObj(), 'obj': MyObj()} primitive = ser.serialize_entity(self.context, obj) self.assertEqual(2, len(primitive)) for item in primitive: self.assertIn(item, ['foo', 'obj']) self.assertNotIsInstance(primitive[item], base.NovaObject) thing2 = ser.deserialize_entity(self.context, primitive) self.assertEqual(2, len(thing2)) for item in thing2: self.assertIsInstance(thing2[item], MyObj)

commit_message:
For function "find_resource", should firstly handle falvor id.

	    For perviously logic, if flavor id is start with "0Number", int(name_or_id) will convert it to "Number". If flavor id "Number" exist in DB, it will a
	    This fix enter flavor search logic at the beginning. Also add one more UT for this function.

	    Fix bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+bug/1268456
Change-Id: I015d7a7f5c07980c0e5f4ed03fdc8d189cadabb7

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated include_class matcher

include_class is deprecated since rspec-puppet 1.0.0.
contain_class should be used instead.

Closes-bug: #1263617
Change-Id: If2e5a2c467a5d1c4eb130dc6b2643d05c748abe0
(cherry picked from commit f745cf634fa2cf9889a2ef03ee9de3a3d0d1045b)

commit_message:
Only add ceilometer user to nova group if using compute agent

When using ceilometer outside of the compute context (ex: with the
swift middleware), puppet-ceilometer attempts to add the user to
the nova group which does not (and probably should not) exist on
the swift nodes.

Change-Id: I6cc68152325a967c024ce611f92a90ce0afba8cc
(cherry picked from commit d064997cd4c50d9b5365fe2ffca60e14a86b08e1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/28/66628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove "Delete" buttons when VPN objects are in use

Deleting attached services and policies doesn't
cause NotImplementedError anymore. Moreover,
options "Delete VPN Service", "Delete IKE Policy" and
"Delete IPSec Policy" don't appear in corresponding row
if there is a connection created using these objects.
Some tests are added to detect such errors in future.

Fixes bug 1252330

Change-Id: I9ed1b4ecdad54b89bef45b2f5e422c30447cceb5

commit_message:
Improve docs about horizon settings

added ALLOWED_HOSTS
added SESSION_TIMEOUT

Since settings become longer and longer, I re-arranged the options
in alphabetical order.

Change-Id: I4424cc178ec0cd7892b0f07cb0192b5af5b2ee0d
Partial-bug: #1221115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/74/65074/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Most of the following settings are defined in ``openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py``, which should be copied from ``openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example``. ``ALLOWED_HOSTS`` ----------------- Default: ``"['localhost', ]"`` This array should contain the names (and or IP addresses) of the host running the Dashboard; if the dashboard is being accessed via name, the DNS name (and probably short-name) should be added, if it's accessed via IP-address, that should be used. The setting may contain more than one entry. ``AVAILABLE_REGIONS``Default: ``None`` A tuple of tuples which define multiple regions. The tuple format is ``('http://{{keystone_host}}:5000/v2.0', '{{region_name}}')``. If any regions are specified the login form will have a dropdown selector for authenticating to the appropriate region, and there will be a region switcher dropdown in the site header when logged in. If you do not have multiple regions you should use the ``OPENSTACK_HOST`` and ``OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL`` settings above instead. ``OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE`` --------------------------- Default: ``"publicURL"`` A string which specifies the endpoint type to use for the endpoints in the Keystone service catalog. The default value for all services except for identity is ``"publicURL"`` . The default value for the identity service is ``"internalURL"``. ``OPENSTACK_HOST`` ------------------ Default: ``"127.0.0.1"`` The hostname of the Keystone server used for authentication if you only have one region. This is often the *only* settings that needs to be set for a basic deployment. ``OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES`` --------------------------------- Default: ``{'can_set_mount_point': False, 'can_set_password': True}`` A dictionary containing settings which can be used to identify the capabilities of the hypervisor for Nova. The Xen Hypervisor has the ability to set the mount point for volumes attached to instances (other Hypervisors currently do not). Setting ``can_set_mount_point`` to ``True`` will add the option to set the mount point from the UI. Setting ``can_set_password`` to ``False`` will remove the option to set an administrator password when launching or rebuilding an instance. ``OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_BACKEND`` ------------------------------ Default: ``{'name': 'native', 'can_edit_user': True, 'can_edit_project': True}`` A dictionary containing settings which can be used to identify the capabilities of the auth backend for Keystone. If Keystone has been configured to use LDAP as the auth backend then set ``can_edit_user`` and ``can_edit_project`` to ``False`` and name to ``"ldap"``. ``OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE`` ----------------------------------- Default: ``"Member"`` The name of the role which will be assigned to a user when added to a project. This name must correspond to a role name in Keystone. ``OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL`` -------------------------- Default: ``"http://%s:5000/v2.0" % OPENSTACK_HOST`` The full URL for the Keystone endpoint used for authentication. Unless you are using HTTPS, running your Keystone server on a nonstandard port, or using a nonstandard URL scheme you shouldn't need to touch this setting. ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK`` ----------------------------- Default: ``{'enable_lb': False}`` A dictionary of settings which can be used to enable optional services provided by neutron. Currently only the load balancer service is available. ``OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT`` ------------------------ Default: ``None`` When unset or set to ``None`` the default CA certificate on the system is used for SSL verification. When set with the path to a custom CA certificate file, this overrides use of the default system CA certificate. This custom certificate is used to verify all connections to openstack services when making API calls. ``OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY`` --------------------------- Default: ``False`` Disable SSL certificate checks in the OpenStack clients (useful for self-signed certificates). ``POLICY_FILES`` ---------------- Default: ``{'identity': 'keystone_policy.json', 'compute': 'nova_policy.json'}`` This should essentially be the mapping of the contents of ``POLICY_FILES_PATH`` to service types. When policy.json files are added to ``POLICY_FILES_PATH``, they should be included here too. ``POLICY_FILES_PATH`` --------------------- Default: ``os.path.join(ROOT_PATH, "conf")`` Specifies where service based policy files are located. These are used to define the policy rules actions are verified against. ``SESSION_TIMEOUT`` ------------------- Default: ``"1800"`` Specifies the timespan in seconds inactivity, until a user is considered as logged out.

commit_message:
Adding testenv worker wrapper script

Adds a script 60-setup-testenvs which is run by os-refresh-config. On
first boot this carves up the host into a number of test environments
and starts a gearman worker for each environment, noop if run more
than once. Each test environment will have a seed, 3 vm's all on
their own bridge.

Depends-on: Ie33736850ec8186f0c90b82b6fbb0fd57fe47dc9
Change-Id: I46b2c95ccbda484b4de03585b830ac578df0e937
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/52/61052/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2013 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Calculate number of envs to setup based on lowest of Host Mem/CPU and Disk MEMTOTAL=$(free -g | awk '/Mem/ {print $2}') NUMENVS=$( expr $MEMTOTAL / ${1:-16} ) CPUTOTAL=$(grep "^processor" /proc/cpuinfo | wc -l) ENVS=$(expr $CPUTOTAL / ${2:-4}) if [ "$ENVS" -lt "$NUMENVS" ] ; then NUMENVS=$ENVS fi DISKTOTALK=$(df /var/lib/libvirt/images/ | awk '/^\// {print $2}') ENVS=$(expr $DISKTOTALK / 1024 / 1024 / ${3:-80}) if [ "$ENVS" -lt "$NUMENVS" ] ; then NUMENVS=$ENVS fi echo "Setting up $NUMENVS test environments" #cd /opt/stack/tripleo-incubator #export PATH=/opt/stack/tripleo-incubator/scripts/:$PATH #./scripts/install-dependencies #TODO: use os-apply-config so passing in env vars isn't needed PUBLIC_INTERFACE_ROUTE= PHYSICAL_INTERFACE_IP= PHYSICAL_INTERFACE_RAW_DEVICE= \ PHYSICAL_INTERFACE=eth2 EXTERNAL_BRIDGE=br-ctlplane init-neutron-ovs for num in $(seq 0 $NUMENVS) ; do DATAFILE=$(mktemp /tmp/test_env_${num}_XXXXXX) LOGFILE=${DATAFILE}.log scripts/setup-network $num # TODO : get these MAC so they can be put in the data file ./scripts/create-nodes 1 4 30 amd64 3 brbm$num # TODO : add flag to boot-seed-vm so the dib is a noop ./scripts/boot-seed-vm -o seed_$num -b brbm$num -n # Chane the public interface of this seed to place it on br-ctlplane virsh dumpxml seed_$num | \ sed -e "s/source network='default'\/>/source bridge='br-ctlplane'\/><virtualport type='openvswitch'\/>/g" | \ sed -e "0,/interface type='network'/s//interface type='bridge'/g" > seed_${num}_new.xml virsh define seed_$(num)_new.xml # TODO : get creds from somehwere # TODO : save allocated IP so place it in datafile # TODO : Use the seed MAC address neutron port-create --name te_$(hostname)_$num \ --mac-address 52:54:00:51:e7:ed ctlplane # TODO : get IP from somewhere testenv-worker -b 10.10.16.175 $DATAFILE > $LOGFILE 2>&1 & done

passed to devtest_setup.sh

commit_message:
Use wait condition when waiting for undercloud

We can now use the Heat stack wait condition to determine that the
undercloud node is up and fully initialized.

Change-Id: Ie9f026288e783188dca80421f7282283bea3511c

commit_message:
Move devstack hooks from infra config to solum repo

To minimize the work done in infra project and reduce the dependency, let us
have the code in solum repository and invoke the same from devstack job.

Change-Id: I910aa8ae6f9b4083952ca27d9f3c6807532ef784
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/07/65507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # This script is executed by devstack gate before running the tests # Remove oslo.sphinx from test-requirements.txt as it is # causing issues and we don't need it for functional tests. # http://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg13109.html # (TODO) Remove this hack once we have permanent fix for this issue. TEMPDIR=`mktemp -d` sed '/oslo.sphinx/d' /opt/stack/new/solum/test-requirements.txt > $TEMPDIR/test-requirements.txt # Install packages from test-requirements.txt sudo pip install -r $TEMPDIR/test-requirements.txt # Install solum devstack integration SOLUM_BASE=/opt/stack/new/solum/contrib/devstack DEVSTACK_BASE=/opt/stack/new/devstack cp $SOLUM_BASE/lib/* $DEVSTACK_BASE/lib cp $SOLUM_BASE/extras.d/* $DEVSTACK_BASE/extras.d

commit_message:
Exceptions cleanup

Most TaskFlow exception don't have 'Exception' suffix in their names, so
we drop it from the few that have it, for sake of consistency and more
concise and expressive code.

MissingDependencies parent object is changed from InvalidState to
InvariantViolation, which is more appropriate.

Unused ClosedException is dropped.

Breaking change: any client code that used renamed exceptions,
ClosedException or relied on catching MissingDependencies as
InvariantViolationException is affected.

Change-Id: I649b7760d382ccb6df333bdffd667ba6b67a431e

commit_message:
rubocop compliance

all cops now pass except for the following
(which are silenced in .rubocop.yml )

* LineLength, MethodLength: not sure if we care about these
* WordArray: I prefer [] vs %w{} for readability.

Conflicts:
	metadata.rb
	recipes/common.rb
	recipes/openvswitch.rb
	spec/openvswitch_spec.rb

commit_message:
Implement Rubocop

Per the blueprint, finish implementing rubocop across the entire
cookbook, remove tailor references, and update rubocop dependency.

- Remove .tailor file
- Update Rubocop Dependency >= 0.16.0
- Update Chef Dependency to 11.8
- Add .rubocop.yml files to resources/providers
- Add resources/providers to Strainerfile
- Update all files necessary to pass rubocop

Change-Id: Icc4804b3e2a55cf6656b2e6077e36f04d959b9ef
Implements: blueprint rubocop-for-image

commit_message:
Add API binding options

Ceilometer is able to bind API server to both an IP address and a port.
This patch aims to add support for both configuration flags.

Change-Id: I83164a925cf115d091cb04d14922ee7bbdd0ac63
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit f8eea90cd9f1652ba927bfcc9bf8234af8983c11)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/24/66624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 14:41:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/70de4963935c7394bd4377ffa8acef163e425074', 'message': "Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent

I removed packages installed as dependencies by the Open vSwitch
plug-in agent package on Ubuntu and Debian. For example, the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package automatically installs
the openvswitch-switch package, so the instructions shouldn't
specifically call out installing the latter.

Also, on the controller node which doesn't need to run the OVS
plug-in agent but still needs to know about the configured plug-in,
I changed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package to the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch package.

Change-Id: I13a50854149109a10155d0b6b05307a663563438
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264184
(cherry picked from commit 6931ad585b0392bdd118e6a40258caa5887ffd9d)
"}]
commit_message:
Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent

I removed packages installed as dependencies by the Open vSwitch
plug-in agent package on Ubuntu and Debian. For example, the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package automatically installs
the openvswitch-switch package, so the instructions shouldn't
specifically call out installing the latter.

Also, on the controller node which doesn't need to run the OVS
plug-in agent but still needs to know about the configured plug-in,
I changed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package to the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch package.

Change-Id: I13a50854149109a10155d0b6b05307a663563438
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264184
(cherry picked from commit 6931ad585b0392bdd118e6a40258caa5887ffd9d)

commit_message:
Replace oslo.uuidutils module with trove.utils

Oslo is removing uuidutils during the icehouse cycle.
Consequently we need to remove all references to uuidutils, and
replace them with the corresponding function from trove.utils.

Change-Id: Idd4b25e98624dfb6a25e275cac44a54324f50449
Closes-bug: 1253497

commit_message:
Updates oslo.context

This change is needed for uuidutils removal in Trove

13eb01c Adding domain to context and log
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
bdabd51 Remove uuidutils imports in oslo modules

Change-Id: I3b4eead93fc2d12ccb6a0837f9100b784b25d8dd

commit_message:
Relocates generate_random_password to common.utils

Reasons:
- instance.models._create_resources is still uses uuid as root_password.
- generate_random_password needs to be used in a diferent module, so it
  is a candidate to be moved to trove.common.utils, so that any
  new change could be made at one place only, affecting all used-cases.

Changes:
- Relocates generate_random_password to common.utils
- Replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid with generate_random_password in
  trove.instance.models._create_resources(password_length).

Change-Id: Ib58bf83b3c052261418907db41ca963768d2e710
Closes-Bug: #1264330

commit_message:
Fix broken iptables command in cinder

Fixes a broken iptables command from
3f34fc4d287fcd2ed7a1be9e116c85a8d336b19e.

This was causing invalid port/service errors.

Also, fixes an issue where the /var/run/cinder
directory doesn't actually exist.

With both of these fixes the cinder element
actually runs for me.

Change-Id: I236a84ac7c73b0295d4734fac62f94b9722bd512
Closes-bug: 1269143
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/84/66684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mkdir -p /var/run/cinder chown -R cinder:cinder /var/run/cinder iptables -I INPUT -p tcp -m multiport --dports 3260,8776 -j ACCEPT

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Super hackomatic nova-network test

This is a very hacky patch to test performance characteristics
of nova-network if it were to go through conductor like
nova-compute.

Change-Id: I564ae8be04fa2ee2e41d21ca734a9fd5d264a85e

commit_message:
PXEAndSSH driver lacked vendor_passthru

Add vendor_passthru interface to PXEAndSSHDriver
to allow PXE-based deploys to continue.

Change-Id: Ief087f75b0b6975ed2b461f46cddcc9067316efe
Closes-bug: 1268066

commit_message:
Replace calls to pyudev with calls to a fake pyudev when not available

When running tox on platforms that do not have pyudev, tox exits with an
error due to the import error.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/023268.html

Change-Id: I94de089ea0b661f62dedecd9977379adb56def6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/26/66426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: import pyudev except ImportError: import fake_pyudev as pyudev linuxbridge_neutron_agent.pyudev = pyudev

commit_message:
Improve testing of list_extensions for compute

This commit takes the testing for list_extension from the volumes
extensions client and uses it for the compute testing of
list_extensions. This also fixes a skip decorator to use use
requires_ext instead of calling is_extension_enabled directly.

Change-Id: Id08f39e09df0aea0d3c8f507f421c82ddf32900f

commit_message:
JobExecutionsManager.create() should handle input_id/output_id == None

Input and output ids are not part of the Java workflow JSON schema. Including
them, even set to None, causes an error.  In order to maintain backward
compatibility, leave input_id and output_id as required parameters but
do not add them to the job exec data if they are None.

Closes-Bug: #1268695
Change-Id: I8df8cb86094f5d67ca16de7d6dd253af142eca25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/62/66662/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Leave these out if they are null. For Java job types they # are not part of the schema io_ids = (("input_id", input_id), ("output_id", output_id)) for key, value in io_ids: if value is not None: data.update(key: value) # These are always required

commit_message:
L3 Agent can handle many external networks

With this patch a l3 agent can handle
any networks by setting the neutron
parameter external_network_bridge
and gateway_external_network_id to
empty.

Related-Bug: #1234750
Related-Bug: #1194350

Change-Id: Id260a239df23951da730513f40cda490002effc3

commit_message:
Added cache for image_username

This change removes roundtrip to nova for each remote() call.

It is also important for long provision operations because auth
token could expire during cluster provisioning timeframe.

Introduced nodegroup.image_username field with information about
username used.

Change-Id: I00f318a9bf34b221c8ccf7a4f22e9ed3fd91e806
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/02/65402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extra = node_group.extra if extra and extra.get('image_username'): return extra['image_username'] image_username = _get_node_group_image_username(node_group) extra_dict = extra.to_dict() if extra else {} extra_dict['image_username'] = image_username conductor.node_group_update(context.ctx(), node_group, {"extra": extra_dict}) return image_username

commit_message:
Fix WADL validation errors

The dbaas.wadl file contains many text blocks which need to be
wrapped in <para> tags. Newer versions of clouddocs-maven-plugin
validate these blocks, resulting in docs build errors until they are
fixed.

Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia5733a7fb1c0827a7cec500e1ee51a896a0e7754
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/29/58329/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Database instances are directly accessible only on the internal ServiceNet network and using a Cloud resource within the same regional datacenter. For example, a database instance in DFW can only be accessed by a Cloud Server in DFW. For details and information about using a public Cloud Load Balancer to allow access to your database instance, refer to for details. Rather than the flavor URI, you can also pass the flavor id (integer) as the value for flavorRef. For example, the flavor id for the flavor URI shown above is "1". This operation does not delete any read slaves. This operation is not allowed when the instance state is either REBUILDING or BUILDING. After instance creation, the used size of your volume will be in the response when the status for the instance is BUILD, REBOOT, or RESIZE. The MySQL service will be unavailable until the instance restarts. You cannot increase the volume to a size larger than the API volume size limit specifies. The following database names are reserved and cannot be used for creating databases: lost+found, information_schema, and mysql. This operation returns only the user-defined databases, not the system databases. The system databases (mysql, information_schema, lost+found) can only be viewed by a database administrator. This operation does not return the system users (database administrators that administer the health of the database). Also, this operation returns the "root" user only if "root" user has been enabled. There is a bug in a python library that Rackspace is using that may cause incorrect user deletions to occur be incorrectly deleted. To avoid the problem, do not use periods in user names. Changes you make as a root user may cause detrimental effects to the database instance and unpredictable behavior for API operations. When you enable the root user, you accept the possibility that we will not be able to support your database instance. While enabling root does not prevent us from a “best effort” approach to helping you if something goes wrong with your instance, we cannot ensure that we will be able to assist you if you change core MySQL settings. These changes can be (but are not limited to) turning off binlogs, removing users that we use to access your instance, and so forth. The flavorId parameter should be an integer. If a floating point value is used for the flavorId parameter, the decimal portion is truncated and the integer portion is used as the value of the flavorId.

For example, a database instance in DFW can only be accessed by a Cloud Server in DFW. For details and information about using a public Cloud Load Balancer to allow access to your database instance, refer to for details. Rather than the flavor URI, you can also pass the flavor id (integer) as the value for flavorRef. For example, the flavor id for the flavor URI shown above is "1". This operation does not delete any read slaves. This operation is not allowed when the instance state is either REBUILDING or BUILDING. After instance creation, the used size of your volume will be in the response when the status for the instance is BUILD, REBOOT, or RESIZE. The MySQL service will be unavailable until the instance restarts. You cannot increase the volume to a size larger than the API volume size limit specifies. The following database names are reserved and cannot be used for creating databases: lost+found, information_schema, and mysql. This operation returns only the user-defined databases, not the system databases. The system databases (mysql, information_schema, lost+found) can only be viewed by a database administrator. This operation does not return the system users (database administrators that administer the health of the database). Also, this operation returns the "root" user only if "root" user has been enabled. There is a bug in a python library that Rackspace is using that may cause incorrect user deletions to occur be incorrectly deleted. To avoid the problem, do not use periods in user names. Changes you make as a root user may cause detrimental effects to the database instance and unpredictable behavior for API operations. When you enable the root user, you accept the possibility that we will not be able to support your database instance. While enabling root does not prevent us from a “best effort” approach to helping you if something goes wrong with your instance, we cannot ensure that we will be able to assist you if you change core MySQL settings. These changes can be (but are not limited to) turning off binlogs, removing users that we use to access your instance, and so forth. The flavorId parameter should be an integer. If a floating point value is used for the flavorId parameter, the decimal portion is truncated and the integer portion is used as the value of the flavorId.

commit_message:
checking for metaclass to be Python 3.x compatible

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.(H236)

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I24a00d9e59ffdd9abf4ccf3919737bdb079819eb
Related-Bug: #1236648
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/90/56890/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If you want using metaclass, you should use six.add_metaclass. Example:: import six @six.add_metaclass(Meta) class YourClass(): ...

commit_message:
Add finer granularity to host aggregate APIs

This change provides the ability to set finer permission rules around
the host aggregate APIs. Prior to this change, all operations assumed
that the same permissions were necessary. However, it's very possible
that an OpenStack administrator may want to have varying sets of
permissions for operations across the standard CRUD operations.  This
change is only applicable to the v3 APIs as v2 APIs should remain
backwards compatible.

Also included is a change to fake_policy.py (since the file was
updated anyway) to make the base aggregate policy require the
'admin_api' rule (i.e., to be consistent with the policy.json file).

Also added the corresponding API test cases.

DocImpact v3 host aggregate APIs require action-level policies
Implements: blueprint aggregate-api-policy

Change-Id: I8a88824bbb41807fad849ad15af4411d3a3dca6e

commit_message:
Add filter and pagination to stack_get_all

This change prepares the ground for calls that are not tenant-scoped
to make use of the filter and paging capabilities.

Implements: blueprint management-api
Change-Id: I4862752999629666b46da20c2713edc950c5d52e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/39/63039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(db_api, '_paginate_query') def test_filter_and_page_query_paginates_query(self, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() db_api._filter_and_page_query(self.ctx, query) assert mock_paginate_query.called @mock.patch.object(db_api.db_filters, 'exact_filter') def test_filter_and_page_query_handles_no_filters(self, mock_db_filter): query = mock.Mock() db_api._filter_and_page_query(self.ctx, query) mock_db_filter.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, mock.ANY, {}) @mock.patch.object(db_api.db_filters, 'exact_filter') def test_filter_and_page_query_applies_filters(self, mock_db_filter): query = mock.Mock() filters = {'foo': 'bar'} db_api._filter_and_page_query(self.ctx, query, filters=filters) assert mock_db_filter.called @mock.patch.object(db_api, '_paginate_query') def test_filter_and_page_query_whitelists_sort_keys(self, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() sort_keys = ['name', 'foo'] db_api._filter_and_page_query(self.ctx, query, sort_keys=sort_keys) args, _ = mock_paginate_query.call_args self.assertIn(['name'], args) @mock.patch.object(db_api.utils, 'paginate_query') def test_paginate_query_default_sorts_by_created_at_and_id( self, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() model = mock.Mock() db_api._paginate_query(self.ctx, query, model, sort_keys=None) args, _ = mock_paginate_query.call_args self.assertIn(['created_at', 'id'], args) @mock.patch.object(db_api.utils, 'paginate_query') def test_paginate_query_default_sorts_dir_by_desc(self, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() model = mock.Mock() db_api._paginate_query(self.ctx, query, model, sort_dir=None) args, _ = mock_paginate_query.call_args self.assertIn('desc', args) @mock.patch.object(db_api.utils, 'paginate_query') def test_paginate_query_uses_given_sort_plus_id(self, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() model = mock.Mock() db_api._paginate_query(self.ctx, query, model, sort_keys=['name']) args, _ = mock_paginate_query.call_args self.assertIn(['name', 'id'], args) @mock.patch.object(db_api.utils, 'paginate_query') @mock.patch.object(db_api, 'model_query') def test_paginate_query_gets_model_marker(self, mock_query, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() model = mock.Mock() marker = mock.Mock() mock_query_object = mock.Mock() mock_query_object.get.return_value = 'real_marker' mock_query.return_value = mock_query_object db_api._paginate_query(self.ctx, query, model, marker=marker) mock_query_object.get.assert_called_once_with(marker) args, _ = mock_paginate_query.call_args self.assertIn('real_marker', args) @mock.patch.object(db_api.utils, 'paginate_query') def test_paginate_query_raises_invalid_sort_key(self, mock_paginate_query): query = mock.Mock() model = mock.Mock() mock_paginate_query.side_effect = db_api.utils.InvalidSortKey() self.assertRaises(exception.Invalid, db_api._paginate_query, self.ctx, query, model, sort_keys=['foo']) def test_filter_sort_keys_returns_empty_list_if_no_keys(self): sort_keys = None whitelist = None filtered_keys = db_api._filter_sort_keys(sort_keys, whitelist) self.assertEqual([], filtered_keys) def test_filter_sort_keys_whitelists_single_key(self): sort_key = 'foo' whitelist = ['foo'] filtered_keys = db_api._filter_sort_keys(sort_key, whitelist) self.assertEqual(['foo'], filtered_keys) def test_filter_sort_keys_whitelists_multiple_keys(self): sort_keys = ['foo', 'bar', 'nope'] whitelist = ['foo', 'bar'] filtered_keys = db_api._filter_sort_keys(sort_keys, whitelist) self.assertIn('foo', filtered_keys) self.assertIn('bar', filtered_keys) self.assertNotIn('nope', filtered_keys)

commit_message:
port admin/test_servers* into Nova V3 tests part2

1. porting admin/test_servers.py and admin/test_servers_negative.py
   into nova v3
2. sync nova v2 changes in Ibd04a1fdaab74fe59bcf16cc99d4ecf4821f4ae2
3. fix a few typos in servers_client.py

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: I319bef11d1aee11ffa892c366cd57eef338b36ee
Closes-Bug: #1259056

added_lines: def test_list_servers_filter_by_shutoff_status(self): # Filter the list of servers by server status params = {'status': 'shutoff'} self.client.stop(s1['id']) self.client.wait_for_server_status(s1['id'], 'SHUTOFF') resp, body = self.client.list_servers(params) self.client.start(s1['id']) self.client.wait_for_server_status(s1['id'], 'ACTIVE') servers = body['servers'] self.assertIn(self.s1['id'], map(lambda x: x['id'], servers)) @attr(type='gate')

commit_message:
Remove copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Change-Id: I91ef63a07519723b0b499e21f4b11aea6bfee8d1
Closes-Bug: #1262424

commit_message:
[Vanilla] Added unit test on get_hadoop_ssh_keys method

Change-Id: Ib096982f4e154d5ddb5b7bb19a177b023967f7e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/67/66067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from savanna import conductor as cond from savanna.conductor import resource as r from savanna import contextfrom savanna.tests.unit import base as models_test_baseconductor = cond.API def _resource_passthrough(*args, **kwargs): return True class VanillaPluginTest(models_test_base.DbTestCase): r.Resource._is_passthrough_type = _resource_passthrough super(VanillaPluginTest, self).setUp() def test_get_hadoop_ssh_keys(self): cluster_dict = { 'name': 'test_cluster', 'plugin_name': 'mock_plugin', 'hadoop_version': 'mock_version', 'default_image_id': 'initial', 'node_groups': [tu._make_ng_dict("ng1", "f1", ["s1"], 1)]} cluster = conductor.cluster_create(context.ctx(), cluster_dict) (private_key1, public_key1) = c_h.get_hadoop_ssh_keys(cluster) cluster = conductor.cluster_get(context.ctx(), cluster) (private_key2, public_key2) = c_h.get_hadoop_ssh_keys(cluster) self.assertEqual(public_key1, public_key2) self.assertEqual(private_key1, private_key2)

cleanup nits in federation docs

commit_message:
Remove PostgreSQL dependencies from Barbican.

PostgreSQL is an optional database type for use with Barbican, so there
is no need to include that as a forced dependency on Barbican.

Change-Id: I260ce85475b83079d173ad57f3e755efd1841483

commit_message:
Isolated network support

This patch aims to enable support for both:
- isolated metadata which enable metadata support on isolated networks.
- metadata networks which allows for serving metadata requests coming
  from a dedicated metadata access network

Change-Id: I0e892c4183bd2bf1910b9b6758c1759475053529
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/52/63952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*enable_isolated_metadata*] # (optional) enable metadata support on isolated networks. # Defaults to false. # # [*enable_metadata_network*] # (optional) Allows for serving metadata requests coming from a dedicated metadata # access network whose cidr is 169.254.169.254/16 (or larger prefix), and is # connected to a Neutron router from which the VMs send metadata request. # This option requires enable_isolated_metadata = True # Defaults to false. # $package_ensure = present, $enabled = true, $debug = false, $state_path = '/var/lib/neutron', $resync_interval = 30, $interface_driver = 'neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver', $dhcp_driver = 'neutron.agent.linux.dhcp.Dnsmasq', $root_helper = 'sudo neutron-rootwrap /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf', $use_namespaces = true, $enable_isolated_metadata = false, $enable_metadata_network = false if (! $enable_isolated_metadata) and $enable_metadata_network { fail('enable_metadata_network to true requires enable_isolated_metadata also enabled.') } else { neutron_dhcp_agent_config { 'DEFAULT/enable_isolated_metadata': value => $enable_isolated_metadata; 'DEFAULT/enable_metadata_network': value => $enable_metadata_network; } }

commit_message:
removing run_tests.sh

run_tests.sh is a shell script that builds a virtualenv, runs
setup.py, and executes tests.  This file is not used by the
build process or by developers.  Tox is being used for this
functionality.

Change-Id: Ib86cdc98052154b9f5b40f09f9786a827a754792
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/35/66635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash function usage { echo "Usage: $0 [OPTION]..." echo "Run Barbican's test suite(s)" echo "" echo " -V, --virtual-env Always use virtualenv. Install automatically if not present" echo " -N, --no-virtual-env Don't use virtualenv. Run tests in local environment" echo " -f, --force Force a clean re-build of the virtual environment. Useful when dependencies have been added." echo " --unittests-only Run unit tests only, exclude functional tests." echo " -p, --pep8 Just run pep8" echo " -h, --help Print this usage message" echo "" echo "Note: with no options specified, the script will try to run the tests in a virtual environment," echo " If no virtualenv is found, the script will ask if you would like to create one. If you " echo " prefer to run tests NOT in a virtual environment, simply pass the -N option." exit } function process_option { case "$1" in -h|--help) usage;; -V|--virtual-env) let always_venv=1; let never_venv=0;; -N|--no-virtual-env) let always_venv=0; let never_venv=1;; -p|--pep8) let just_pep8=1;; -f|--force) let force=1;; --unittests-only) noseargs="$noseargs --exclude-dir=barbican/tests/functional";; *) noseargs="$noseargs $1" esac } venv=.venv with_venv=tools/with_venv.sh always_venv=0 never_venv=0 force=0 noseargs= wrapper="" just_pep8=0 for arg in "$@"; do process_option $arg done function run_tests { # Just run the test suites in current environment ${wrapper} rm -f tests.sqlite ${wrapper} $NOSETESTS 2> run_tests.err.log } function run_pep8 { echo "Running pep8 ..." PEP8_OPTIONS="--exclude=$PEP8_EXCLUDE --repeat" PEP8_INCLUDE="bin/* barbican tools setup.py run_tests.py" ${wrapper} pep8 $PEP8_OPTIONS $PEP8_INCLUDE } NOSETESTS="python run_tests.py $noseargs" if [ $never_venv -eq 0 ] then # Remove the virtual environment if --force used if [ $force -eq 1 ]; then echo "Cleaning virtualenv..." rm -rf ${venv} fi if [ -e ${venv} ]; then wrapper="${with_venv}" else if [ $always_venv -eq 1 ]; then # Automatically install the virtualenv python tools/install_venv.py wrapper="${with_venv}" else echo -e "No virtual environment found...create one? (Y/n) \c" read use_ve if [ "x$use_ve" = "xY" -o "x$use_ve" = "x" -o "x$use_ve" = "xy" ]; then # Install the virtualenv and run the test suite in it python tools/install_venv.py wrapper=${with_venv} fi fi fi fi if [ $just_pep8 -eq 1 ]; then run_pep8 exit fi run_tests || exit if [ -z "$noseargs" ]; then run_pep8 fi

commit_message:
Remove __MARCONI_SETUP__

The built-in Marconi used to use to track the service bootstrap process,
is not needed anymore. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ia599bd07006306a5b6368d52cd8548cb50b3d01e

commit_message:
Step 2 refactoring Mistral engines

 * Combine common parts of single and scalable engines

Change-Id: Iaa8708a831ca22a79d3ecd59c960be09a904e57a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/91/65991/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistral.engine import abstract_engine as abs_engfrom mistral.engine import workflowclass SingleEngine(abs_eng.AbstractEngine): def start_workflow_execution(self, workbook_name, target_task_name): wb_dsl = self._get_wb_dsl(workbook_name) dsl_tasks = workflow.find_workflow_tasks(wb_dsl, target_task_name) db_api.start_tx() try: # Persist execution and tasks in DB. execution = self._create_execution(workbook_name, target_task_name) tasks = self._create_tasks(dsl_tasks, wb_dsl, workbook_name, execution['id']) #return tasks self._run_tasks(workflow.find_tasks_to_start(tasks)) return execution finally: db_api.end_tx() def convey_task_result(self, workbook_name, execution_id, task_id, state, result): db_api.start_tx() #TODO(rakhmerov): validate state transition # Update task state. task = db_api.task_update(workbook_name, execution_id, task_id, {"state": state, "result": result}) # Determine what tasks need to be started. tasks = db_api.tasks_get(workbook_name, execution_id) try: if self._determine_workflow_is_finished(workbook_name, execution, task): db_api.commit_tx() return task if workflow.is_success(tasks): db_api.execution_update(workbook_name, execution_id, { "state": states.SUCCESS }) db_api.commit_tx() LOG.info("Execution finished with success: %s" % execution) return task self._run_tasks(workflow.find_tasks_to_start(tasks)) finally: db_api.end_tx() def _run_tasks(self, tasks): LOG.info("Workflow is running, tasks to run: %s" % tasks) for t in tasks: self._run_task(t) def _run_task(self, task): action = a_f.create_action(task) LOG.info("Task is started - %s" % task['name']) db_api.task_update(task['workbook_name'], task['execution_id'], task['id'], {'state': states.RUNNING}) return action.run() ENGINE = SingleEngine()
deleted_lines: from mistral import dsl as parserfrom mistral.engine import workflow as wfdef start_workflow_execution(workbook_name, target_task_name): workbook = db_api.workbook_get(workbook_name) wb_dsl = parser.Parser(workbook["definition"]) tasks_dsl = wf.find_workflow_tasks(wb_dsl, target_task_name) db_api.start_tx() try: execution = db_api.execution_create(workbook_name, { 'target_task': target_task_name, 'state': states.RUNNING }) tasks = [] for task_dsl in tasks_dsl: task = db_api.task_create(workbook_name, execution["id"], { "name": task_dsl["name"], "dependencies": task_dsl.get("dependsOn", []), "task_dsl": task_dsl, "service_dsl": wb_dsl.get_service(task_dsl["service_name"]), "state": states.IDLE, "tags": task_dsl.get("tags", None) }) tasks.append(task) _run_tasks(wf.find_tasks_to_start(tasks)) db_api.commit_tx() finally: db_api.end_tx() return execution def stop_workflow_execution(workbook_name, execution_id): return db_api.execution_update(workbook_name, execution_id, {'state': states.STOPPED}) def convey_task_result(workbook_name, execution_id, task_id, state, result): db_api.start_tx() try: task = db_api.task_update(workbook_name, execution_id, task_id, {'state': state, 'result': result}) if task["state"] == states.ERROR: db_api.execution_update(workbook_name, execution_id, { "state": states.ERROR }) return task if states.is_stopped_or_finished(execution["state"]): tasks = db_api.tasks_get(workbook_name, execution_id) if task['name'] == execution['target_task']: db_api.execution_update(workbook_name, execution_id, {'state': state}) else: _run_tasks(wf.find_tasks_to_start(tasks)) db_api.commit_tx() return task finally: db_api.end_tx() def get_workflow_execution_state(workbook_name, execution_id): return db_api.execution_get(workbook_name, execution_id)['state'] def get_task_state(workbook_name, execution_id, task_id): return db_api.task_get(workbook_name, execution_id, task_id)['state'] def _run_tasks(tasks): LOG.info("Workflow is running, tasks to run: %s" % tasks) for t in tasks: _run_task(t) def _run_task(task): action = a_f.create_action(task) LOG.info("Task is started - %s" % task['name']) return action.run()

commit_message:
Add undercloud-vm-ironic-source yaml file

Copies the undercloud-vm-source yaml file and removes portions which
were particular to nova-baremetal, replacing them and paving the way
for further Ironic-specific changes.

Change-Id: Ied49b0f8018291a0851cf2e10d83a174cb180479

commit_message:
Add all and clean targets to makefile

Just for convenience, particularly 'make clean'.

Change-Id: Ic9964ace7fb4c675e84b3b9343fc8239abca44ac

subject: Avoid echoing comment from makefile recipe
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 14:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['Makefile'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/5ea44eb897a1f4da3d95a6ad9c3e875029caf82d', 'message': "Avoid echoing comment from makefile recipe

We include a comment to explain why nova-compute-instance.yaml is
included in the prerequisite list for overcloud.yaml, but this comment
gets echoed by make before it executes the recipe using a shell.

  $> make overcloud.yaml
  # overcloud-source.yaml [..] won't work here because [..]
  # a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py
  python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py overcloud-source.yaml [..]
  mv overcloud.yaml.tmp overcloud.yaml

Instead, maintain a list of files included by overcloud.yaml in a
variable and put a comment above that.

Change-Id: I1af69fbb33e1833170f086aec9b54c5c4e57138f
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid echoing comment from makefile recipe

We include a comment to explain why nova-compute-instance.yaml is
included in the prerequisite list for overcloud.yaml, but this comment
gets echoed by make before it executes the recipe using a shell.

  $> make overcloud.yaml
  # overcloud-source.yaml [..] won't work here because [..]
  # a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py
  python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py overcloud-source.yaml [..]
  mv overcloud.yaml.tmp overcloud.yaml

Instead, maintain a list of files included by overcloud.yaml in a
variable and put a comment above that.

Change-Id: I1af69fbb33e1833170f086aec9b54c5c4e57138f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/75/66575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Files included in overcloud-source.yaml via FileInclude overcloud_source_deps = nova-compute-instance.yaml overcloud.yaml: overcloud-source.yaml swift-source.yaml $(overcloud_source_deps)
deleted_lines: overcloud.yaml: overcloud-source.yaml nova-compute-instance.yaml swift-source.yaml # $^ won't work here because we want to list nova-compute-instance.yaml as # a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py

commit_message:
Step 1 refactoring Mistral engines

 * Action definition was combined in actions module
 * workflow from both single and scalable engines were deleted
 * task from single engine was deleted
 * unit test 'test_workflow' was deleted due to deleting workflow
 * minor fixes to single engine

 Next step will be extracting and combining common parts
 of scalable and single engine.

Change-Id: I15fbbb7f9d5e453c17625423eeb1bf841a19db18

commit_message:
Initial rubocop support for attributes/*.rb

Keeping in accordance with the other projects, adding a few standard
settings for rubocop. Dont check line lengths and dont suggest word arrays
for attributes files.

Addresses: blueprint rubocop-for-identity
Change-Id: I68728d2b9f73362fb4333c34dd6ed611efb4e7af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/82/65782/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # embedded attributes make for long lines LineLength: Enabled: false # %w or %W have not generally been used in attribute files WordArray: Enabled: false

output is more appropriate.
